stories.title: What Is the Web Discovery Project?

stories.text:
I'm a self taught programmer that's starting to advance in my career and would like to offset my stack overflow education with technical books. I've really only read novels though, where I'm just there to have a good time, and I don't care if I don't remember every detail.

When reading technical books I feel like I need to take notes, make Anki decks, take breaks to play with things I'm learning. But I get a touch overwhelmed with the feeling that I should be doing these things without really knowing if that's an effective strategy to reading technical books. How do I best do this?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to Read Technical Books?
Zee – A modern text editor for the terminal written in Rust

stories.text:
I have 15 years of experience doing backend-focused, full-stack web development. I do lots of ops work at my current job (CI setup, DB provisioning, Server Setup, Load Balancers, Monitoring). However I realize there is always a LOT more to learn when it comes to automating, monitoring and scaling infrastructure. Current cloud experience is in AWS.

Is there a certification I can work towards to make myself a competitive candidate for a DevOps/ DevOps Engineer position? Should I just get certified by GCP / AWS?

Currently making around 250k. I am hoping to make around 300k a year (CA is expensive :( ), please let me know if there is a related position that will help me get to that comp. E.g. should I focus more towards devsecops, etc.

Considering this program: https://professionalprograms.mit.edu/online-program-cloud-devops-continuous-transformation/

Thank you!!
stories.title: What Credentials to Get to Move from Senior Full Stack Dev DevOps?
